answers.answer: Hi there.At first, the eye twitching can just be benign myokymias which are related to stress and inadequate rest conditions.  However the progression to other areas of the face may signal something more than just this condition.  Other explanations include micronutrient deficiency such as the B vitamins or can be early signs of demyelinating diseases such as multiple sclerosis (MS).  Systemic problems such as hypertension or diabetes can also give rise to this problem.  I suggest you have these possibilities discussed with your doctors and probably be worked up for such.  For now, relaxation, avoidance of stress, adequate sleep and balanced diet is in order.Regards and God bless.

question: I have had this eye twitching on the right eye for almost a year now, it just started out on the eyelid but has now progressed to my cheek and corner of my mouth. I also have a spinning sensation when I lay down on my right side and I wake up with numbness of my arms, this is crazy! I do have wpw can this be related. I have limited resources so I have had to go to a free clinic which they can't do much. any sugestions Thanks Linda
title: Eye Twitching
